verses.roman:
muñi ye caitanya-dāsa āra nityānanda
dāsa-bhāva-sama nahe anyatra ānanda

synonyms: muñi—I; ye—that; caitanya-dāsa—servant of Lord Caitanya; āra—and; nityānanda—of Lord Nityānanda; dāsa-bhāva—the emotion of being a servant; sama—equal to; nahe—not; anyatra—anywhere else; ānanda—transcendental bliss.
translation: He says, "Nityānanda and I are servants of Lord Caitanya." Nowhere else is there such joy as that which is tasted in this emotion of servitude.
